intro: Ageratum glanduliferum, commonly known as the sticky ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms and is used in gardens and floral arrangements. Ageratum glanduliferum is also valued for its ability to attract beneficial insects like ladybugs and lacewings.
